summary: Military families with incapacitated adult children must provide medical and financial information to DOD to prove the child’s dependency. These families may lose healthcare benefits if their dependency applications are denied. We found that DOD’s policy doesn’t give the military services enough information to make consistent decisions. For example, there isn’t much guidance on financial determinations, so each military service uses its own formula to...
title: Department of Defense: Actions Needed to Improve Management and Oversight of Dependency Determinations for Incapacitated Adult Children
